base: L.G. 173 (October-November), Gambut West (November), Msus (November-December), El Nogra (December)

sources: historyofwar.org - No. 92 Squadron RAF WWII history
asisbiz.com - RAF No 92 (East India) Squadron records
Wikipedia - Unit identification and battle list (corroborated)
Imperial War Museums - RAF Operations Middle East 1940-1943
metadata.notes: Squadron arrived Egypt April 1942, received Spitfires August 1942. Participated in Alam el Halfa (Aug-Sep) and Second El Alamein (Oct-Nov). Tier 2 sources confirm unit designation, aircraft variants (Spitfire Mk Vb/Vc Trop), operational dates, and major battles. Commander name unavailable for Q4 1942 period. Personnel estimates based on standard RAF fighter squadron establishment. Notable pilots include Flt Lt J.L. Waddy (Oct-Nov 1942) and Flt Lt Neville Duke (rejoined Nov 1942, became Flight Commander Feb 1943). Specific aircraft identified: BR491 (Mk Vc Trop, crashed Alexandria), EP465 (Mk Vb Trop, Malta ferry).

tier_1_2_facts_confirmed: Aircraft variants: Spitfire Mk Vb and Mk Vc tropical (historyofwar.org, asisbiz.com)
Base locations: L.G. 173, Gambut West, Msus, El Nogra (historyofwar.org)
Operations: Battle of El Alamein participation (historyofwar.org, IWM)
Operational dates: August 1942 Spitfire arrival, Q4 1942 operations (asisbiz.com, historyofwar.org)
Specific aircraft: BR491 (Mk Vc Trop), EP465 (Mk Vb Trop) (asisbiz.com)
Personnel: Flt Lt J.L. Waddy (Oct-Nov 1942), Neville Duke (Nov 1942) (multiple sources)
source_validation.tier_assignment_rationale: 70% confidence = Tier 2 (review_recommended). Core facts confirmed by multiple Tier 2 sources: unit designation, aircraft types with specific variants, base locations, operational dates, major battles, notable pilots. Missing: squadron commander name for Q4 1942, precise aircraft counts, detailed sortie records. Wikipedia used only for initial identification and corroborated by historyofwar.org and asisbiz.com Tier 2 sources.
